description: From Latin panacēa, from Ancient Greek πανάκεια (panákeia), from πανακής (panakḗs, “all-healing”), from πᾶν (pân, “all”) (equivalent to English pan-) + ἄκος (ákos, “cure”).

nouns.description: panacea (plural panaceas or panaceae or panaceæ)

entries.meaning: A remedy believed to cure all disease and prolong life that was originally sought by alchemists; a cure-all.

examples: A monorail will be a panacea for our traffic woes.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) The plant allheal (Valeriana officinalis), believed to cure all ills.
